Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client are an Insurance consultancy seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst with expertise in Azure Services to play a pivotal role in designing and developing data solutions within their organization.




Role Type: Permanent and Contract Options

Location: London/ Hybrid




Responsibilities

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.




Requirements

Proven working experience as a Business Data Analyst.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, Tableau, Power BI), databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks), and data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Demonstrated analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Experience working with large datasets and distributed computing tools (Hadoop, Spark, etc.)
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, etc.).
Experience with data profiling tools and processes.
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric is desirable.
Professional experience as a Data Modeler/Data Architect in P&C insurance, preferably reinsurance
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels.




Good to Have:

Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Strong understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst – Financial & Legal Data Modelling




£25,000–£35,000 + Bonus | Full-time | Central London (Office-based)

Location: London (Zone 1 – near Charing Cross)

Sector: Analytics | Commercial Disputes | Legal Data | Graduate Roles




We’re working exclusively with a high-performing boutique analytics consultancy that supports legal teams in major commercial disputes. They’re now hiring a Graduate Data Analyst to join their expert team and play a key role in quantifying financial losses, analysing large datasets, and helping deliver evidence-based reports for high-profile cases.




This is a unique opportunity for a numerically gifted graduate to launch their career in an intellectually stimulating and genuinely commercial role. Combining elements of data science, statistical modelling, and financial analytics.




🧠 What you’ll be working on:

Reviewing incomplete, inconsistent datasets and making assumptions to fill data gaps
Preparing clear, auditable Excel-based reports to support financial claims
Writing compelling client-facing reports that communicate your analysis effectively
Collaborating with external parties including law firms, suppliers, and data providers
Using Excel, Word and statistical tools to deliver high-quality work under time pressure




✅ Ideal candidate profile:

Recent graduate (or final-year student) with a 2:1 or above in a quantitative degree
Strong academic track record – target universities include Warwick (MORSE), Imperial, Kings College, LSE, Oxford, or Cambridge
Exceptional numerical skills and strong attention to detail
Comfortable working with incomplete or messy data
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (logical functions, pivot tables, lookups etc.)
Bonus: exposure to Python, R, or other statistical tools




🔎 Interview process:

Stage 1: 10-minute intro interview with the team
Stage 2: In-person 2-hour interview with a case study and presentation
Interviews will begin in early July, with a preference for candidates who can start immediately




💼 The offer:

Salary: £25,000 – £35,000 depending on experience
Full-time, office-based role in Central London
Immediate start preferred (but not essential for strong candidates)
Join a small, smart, collaborative team working on real commercial impact cases




This is an outstanding opportunity to move into high-level analytical work with real-world impact—ideal for numerically gifted graduates looking for more than just a data job.




Apply for immediate consideration.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity at a progressive and successful media agency where you will provide support to the ARMLabs team and media planner buyers at All Response Media by way of data wrangling, analysis and econometrics.

You will be joining a passionate and supportive team of economists who crave answers, enjoy learning, and thrive off working on multiple tasks and projects ranging from data extraction through SQL/Snowflake to analysing the impact of advertising campaigns using time series econometrics models.

This a is great opportunity for newcomers to the data analytics world. You will be trained by the senior members of the team, who will soft manage you on a day-to-day basis, but you will report to the head of data science. There are many opportunities within the role to gain responsibility and develop creative thinking through actionable insight.

A BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or successful completion of a level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship is required to be considered for this role.

About The Company

All Response Media is Europe’s leading performance media agency, providing clients with an “Unfair Competitive Advantage” since 1995, with offices in London, Leeds and Amsterdam

We are progressive, dynamic and a rewarding company where you can develop your skills and build a long-term career in advertising, as part of a highly talented and driven team of over 150 professionals. As a growing agency, you will be a part of a fast-paced, exciting and social company culture that truly enriches employee careers. We show a great level of passion and care for all we do, and our leaders appreciate that embedding a strong team culture is important to the success of ARM. As such, we are passionate about developing strong leaders from within the business.

We provide industry-leading media performance to a growing global client base and partner with some of the most innovative and established businesses to continue our mission to disrupt and innovate the advertising industry. Our success is achieved through the success of our clients, and we do this by cultivating strong working relationships through collaboration, innovation and integration which drives engagement, helping them build strong brands and performance.

We plan and buy across all media channels, on and offline. Our bespoke campaign measurement suite, ARMalytics®, gives us a competitive advantage and is at the core of our model, underpinning the data-led operations of our integrated client business teams and ARMlabs data and systems unit. We actively encourage integration across the agency, therefore those who join us soon find that they have a wealth of knowledge across all marketing disciplines.

Your key responsibilities will include:


Access, investigate and extract data as needed (using Snowflake and SQL)
Manipulate data (format, remove and add data and tables)
Test data for completeness and correctness
Format client reports and data extracts (mainly in Excel and R)
Create own visualisation and dashboards and maintenance of dashboards using an advanced suite of visualisation tools
Manage the log of weekly requests from the ARM teams
Provide web tag data to ARM teams
Assist ARM team with queries regarding the bespoke ARM RAPS system
Assist ARM teams with client setup and configuration on the RAPS system
Analyse Direct Response advertising effectiveness
Compile and report on competitor insights
Run simple econometric regressions in R
Econometrics modelling to answer questions about the effect of advertising
Maintain GDPR compliance with regards to handling of first- and third-party data
Troubleshoot data problems that extend to attribution queries
Identify areas of opportunity with regards to automation and streamline processes
Contribute to further development around wider industry research and use cases


Requirements


BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
Data manipulation skills in R (or Python)
Timeseries econometric regressions experience (Eviews/SAS/R/etc.)
Advanced MS Excel Skills (VLOOKUP's, etc.)
Strong number orientation through abilities in maths, accounting, statistics .
Good communication skills
Good story telling with data skills
MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
Media experience (preferred)
Eligible to work in the UK


Benefits


Competitive salary and bonus
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
Progression and development


Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.
Show more

  • Good communication skills
  • Good story telling with data skills
  • MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
  • Media experience (preferred)
  • Eligible to work in the UK

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and bonus
  • 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
  • Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
  • Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
  • Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
  • Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
  • Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
  • Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
  • Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
  • Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
  • Progression and development

Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
We’re on the lookout for a tech savvy Finance Data Analyst to join our team and help turn complex data into game-changing insight. If you love solving problems, building clarity from chaos, and creating reports that spark better decisions – this one’s for you.

Our Virgin Family

Join the Virgin Group – a diverse collective driving change, enhancing customer experience, and having a blast. We're daring, disrupting industries from finance to space, united as part of the Virgin Family.

Virgin Red rewards customers who live the Virgin lifestyle. Earn Virgin Points across our vast partner network, unlocking everyday rewards and exclusive experiences. As the Virgin network hub, we foster deeper customer understanding, opening doors for partners. Bold, distinctive, customer-centric – that's Virgin Red.

We’re a huge brand, but not a huge team, which means we take a hands-on approach while thinking strategically. Everyone rolls up their sleeves to get things done, making it an exciting and collaborative place to work.

Tell me more


Be the go-to expert for transforming raw data into clear, accurate financial reporting.
Collaborate with data teams acting as the data reports expert and translating data projects and issues into terms the finance team can understand.
Drive efficiency in finance processes through using tools like Power BI and Power Query.
Keep us future-ready by determining key finance reporting requirements when new partners are onboarding, ensuring requirements are met, are scalable and are tested to satisfaction.
Complete regular data reconciliations, assess the impact of inconsistencies, and resolve discrepancies identified.
Own and deliver key finance processes like monthly invoicing, intercompany recharges and cash reporting.


What You’ll Need


Recently qualified in management accounting (CIMA, CGMA, or equivalent)
Advanced Excel skills and hands-on experience with automation tools (Power BI, Power Query, etc.)
A sharp analytical brain and a love for diving into big, complicated datasets
Experience in financial reporting and month-end/year-end processes
A knack for translating financial complexity into everyday language


The extra details

Role type: Permanent

Location: London hub (approx. twice per week) & your home space

Salary: £50,000 - £60,000 plus bonus - We're putting our salaries out there for everyone to see - no smoke and mirrors, just honest numbers. We'll offer a salary that matches your skills, always aiming for room to grow.

Working hours: Full time - We embrace flexible working. Let us know what hours empower you to be at your best both professionally and personally, we’ll try to find a perfect match for you and us.

Benefits: Buckle up for an adventure with Virgin! Our benefits package isn't just a list - it's your ticket to an extraordinary career and life. Imagine unlimited leave for your globe-trotting dreams, a "Screw it, let's do it pot" to enjoy being you, and a learning budget to fuel your curiosity. We've got your back with top-notch health care, family support that goes the extra mile, and a pension plan to keep your future bright. From electric vehicles to flexible volunteering, we're not just offering a job - we're inviting you to join a community that celebrates your whole self.

Closing date: 31 July 2025

Some of the attributes that define a Virgin person just can’t be quantified in words. We pride ourselves on welcoming people from all walks of life, with all sorts of skill sets. Most recently, we successfully campaigned to add ‘Dyslexic Thinking’ as a skill on LinkedIn. We truly value passion for Purpose and Sustainability, welcoming creative thinkers and innovators. Any uniqueness is a strength and will be considered an asset to our workforce. If there is something you would like us to consider, to tailor the hiring process to the way you work best, please don’t hesitate to let us know.

For this role we will need to do a few extra essential checks such as DBS screening or qualification verification. We'll always be upfront about what's needed, get you’re okay first, handling everything sensitively and fairly while keeping your data secure. We are a Fair Chance employer and our people are our secret sauce so, we will always be open to listen to individual circumstances.

Ready to turn your career into the ultimate adventure? Virgin's got the map, the compass, and the crew. Your great adventure awaits!
Show more

Most recently, we successfully campaigned to add ‘Dyslexic Thinking’ as a skill on LinkedIn. We truly value passion for Purpose and Sustainability, welcoming creative thinkers and innovators. Any uniqueness is a strength and will be considered an asset to our workforce. If there is something you would like us to consider, to tailor the hiring process to the way you work best, please don’t hesitate to let us know.

For this role we will need to do a few extra essential checks such as DBS screening or qualification verification. We'll always be upfront about what's needed, get you’re okay first, handling everything sensitively and fairly while keeping your data secure. We are a Fair Chance employer and our people are our secret sauce so, we will always be open to listen to individual circumstances.

Ready to turn your career into the ultimate adventure? Virgin's got the map, the compass, and the crew. Your great adventure awaits!

Title: Data Analyst - Contractor
Description:
Can be based in Dubai or UK - remote

At Horizontal Digital, we hold ourselves to one key belief: You're only as good as your worst customer experience. This mantra is what drives our digital consultancy to think beyond the easy answers and instead create websites, apps, portals, and other experiences that solve customer needs for Fortune 500 companies in intuitive and empathetic ways. And we make this lofty standard a reality by fusing strategy, data, design, and technology together to arrive at solutions that set the bar higher for everyone.

We use these values to fuel superior results:

Lock arms

We forge relationships that make our impact 1,000x stronger. This means working across departments and engaging both our clients and our communities to deliver the greatest good.

Show Hustle

We're not ones to sit on our hands and wait. Instead, we anticipate opportunities, collectively roll up our sleeves, and find ways to execute the exceptional.

Embrace change

From new technologies to workplace philosophies, we welcome the unexpected and constantly anticipate what's next.

Elevate empathy

We listen before we take action. This means understanding a variety of perspectives and holding ourselves to a higher standard of accountability.

Never settle

We motivate each other to push past the easy answers and collectively arrive at bigger, more inspiring ideas.

But Enough About Us. Let's Talk About You.

We're looking for a Data Analyst who brings precision, curiosity, and a problem-solving mindset to every engagement. You'll be instrumental in surfacing insights that fuel our digital experiences — and guide our clients toward smarter, data-backed decisions.

What you'll be doing:


Gather, clean, and interpret large volumes of data across web, campaign, and product analytics
Develop dashboards and reports using Power BI, GA4, and Looker Studio
Work closely with stakeholders to identify performance trends and opportunities across digital platforms
Implement and manage Google Tag Manager (GTM) and DataLayer structures to ensure robust data collection
Collaborate with strategy, design, and tech teams to measure the effectiveness of digital experiences
Translate complex datasets into clear and actionable insights for internal and external stakeholders
Continuously improve tracking accuracy, analytics workflows, and campaign tagging processes


What you bring to the table:


2-4 years of experience in a data analyst or digital analytics role
Proficiency in Google Analytics (GA4), GTM, Power BI, and strong Excel/Sheets knowledge
Experience working with websites and CMS platforms, with an understanding of front-end code (HTML, CSS, JS) a plus
Hands-on experience building and managing GTM containers and custom DataLayers
Experience with ad tracking, media performance analysis, and optimization (DV360, Meta Ads, Google Ads)
Strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex findings in simple terms
Detail-oriented, curious, and comfortable managing multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Bonus: Familiarity with SQL, Python scripting for automation, or experience developing dashboards for marketing teams

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | 6-Month Contract | London (hybrid) | £400 per day

One of our public sector clients is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join their Business Intelligence team on a 6-month contract basis.

You'll play a key role in delivering data-driven insights that support commercial strategy and revenue growth across our global advertising sales business. Working with teams across Sales, Marketing, Finance, Operations and Strategy, you'll provide reporting, dashboards, and market intelligence that inform decision-making.

Key Responsibilities


Produce and maintain sales and performance reports
Monitor Salesforce data and pipeline accuracy
Build insightful Tableau dashboards
Conduct market and competitor analysis
Ensure data quality across systems
Support finance with payment tracking
Deliver ad hoc analysis as needed


What You'll Bring


Strong experience in data analysis or BI, ideally in media or advertising
Proficiency in Excel and Tableau
Ability to interpret complex data for varied stakeholders
Familiarity with CRM (Salesforce), SQL, or Alteryx is a bonus
Excellent communication and attention to detail
Graduate or equivalent qualification is required


This is a 6-month contract working hybrid from London 2 or 3 days per week. Offering a day rate of £400 (inside ir35)

This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills in a fast-paced, creative environment. If you're passionate about turning data into meaningful insights - we want to hear from you.

Apply today to be considered!

McGregor Boyall is an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on any grounds.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Lutine Bell are currently supporting a leading Asset Manager looking to appoint a Data Risk & Governance Analyst. Reporting to the Head of Data Risk & Governance, this individual will play a key role in strengthening the data risk framework in an organisation that is heavily investing into AI.




Responsibilities:

Implement a comprehensive data management framework covering data ownership, data sources, data quality, data usage, and records management.
Actively identify data risks where data does not conform to our data policy, while enhancing data governance practices.
Engage in all business-as-usual activities, ensuring a hands-on approach to managing data risks and governance.
Work closely with Audit, Risk, Business teams, IT, and change programs to support data roles in understanding their responsibilities and implementing data requirements using standardized approaches.




Requirements:

5-10 years Data Governance experience in Financial Services.
Must have detailed understanding of data governance and data risk and controls.
Experience of writing data governance related standards, guidance and processes.
Excellent understanding and practical experience of implementing data governance across multiple stakeholders and roles. Specific experience of data ownership, identification of approved data sources and critical data elements.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst – Data Migration

Hybrid – Occasional Travel to Site

Outside IR35 £550 – 600 per day







Our client is a well-established organisation operating across multiple sectors who are seeking a Data Business Analyst to join their team. You will act as the link between business, technical, and data teams, facilitating the resolution of data issues, documenting mapping specifications, and ensuring integrity throughout the migration.




You’ll need superb communication skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You’ll also need experience in data modelling and data mapping.




Key Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Business Analyst
Strong background in data migration, mapping, and transformation
Experience with data modelling, data dictionaries, and conceptual data flows
Excellent communication skills, able to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders




If this opportunity sounds of interest and you match the required skills, please apply to be considered and to receive further details.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salary: £31,000 FTE

Contract: 1-year fixed term, full time (open to flexible and hybrid working, with regular travel to London and Practices across England)

Location: UK-based; regular travel to Coram Campus, London WC1N 1AZ, and across England

Reporting to: Learning & Insight Lead

Start date: ASAP




We’re looking for a Data Analyst to drive exceptional outcomes for children, break cycles of crime, and ignite system change.




Launched in 2020, SHiFT exists to break the destructive cycle for children and young people (up to 25) caught up in or at risk of crime. We work intensively with those for whom things are getting worse, not better, offering therapeutic, relationship-focused support.

We hope this pack, together with our website (shiftuk.org), helps you understand our mission and the skills we’re looking for. For questions, please email Ella Armstrong (Learning & Insights Lead) at ella.armstrong@shiftuk.org.




Apply by 23:59 on 21 July 2025 by sending:

A short covering letter (max 2 sides of A4) addressed to Ella Armstrong via info@shiftuk.org, outlining your experience and suitability.
A CV, including details of two referees (references won’t be taken up without your permission).
Details of your current notice period.
Our Equality & Diversity Monitoring Form [here].

Key dates:

Shortlisting notifications: 22 July 2025
Staff panel interviews (values-based, virtual): 29 July 2025
Second round (competency-based): 5 or 7 August 2025
A data task will also be part of the process.




The role




SHiFT is an ambitious, fast-growing organisation focused on evidence and impact. Our Learning Team has laid strong data foundations — now we need a Data Analyst to help us deepen our learning culture, support our Voice, Participation & Belonging strategy, and clearly show our impact at practice and systems-change levels.




This new role is perfect for someone looking to step up in data management, training, and insights work. You’ll streamline processes, support accurate data collection, and maximise insights from our custom Salesforce system.




You'll work closely with Practice Coordinators and the wider SHiFT team, so relationship-building, collaboration, and a problem-solving mindset are essential. You’ll have a sharp eye for detail, a ‘can do’ attitude, and the drive to help us improve as we grow.

While strong quantitative skills are essential, we welcome candidates without prior qualitative research experience — we can provide training in qualitative methods (e.g., interviews, focus groups).




If you enjoy making data fun and accessible, love working with non-technical colleagues, and want to use data to drive social change, we want to hear from you.




Equality and diversity




SHiFT is committed to eradicating discrimination based on race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, age, marital status, or socio-economic circumstances. We actively encourage applications from candidates with diverse ethnic backgrounds, particularly because of the over-representation of Black, Brown, and Mixed Heritage children in the youth justice system.




Responsibilities




Data collection & management

Support accurate use of our Salesforce system across Practices.
Assist Practice Teams with data queries and surveys.
Coordinate and quality-check monthly submissions.
Develop reporting tools and dashboards that embed learning and demonstrate impact.

System improvement & efficiency

Identify and implement process improvements.
Contribute to Salesforce development with internal and external partners.
Support training materials and reduce data entry duplication.

Learning & insight generation

Produce routine reports and data summaries.
Use data to support reflection, learning, and system change.
Contribute to exploring data integration across social care, education, justice, and health.




You will bring




Beliefs & alignment
Belief that all people can change and relationships can drive that change.
Commitment to supporting young people to stop offending and contribute positively.
Alignment to SHiFT’s values: ambition, courage, flexibility, tenacity.
Comfort challenging the status quo to raise standards.
Determination, curiosity, and a commitment to continuous learning.
Experience & skills (essential)
Degree-level (or equivalent experience) in a relevant field (e.g., research, sociology, criminology, policy).
Strong data management and analysis skills (Excel, Power BI, ideally Salesforce).
Experience with data entry, cleaning, and quality assurance.
Experience in data visualisation and dashboard design.
Knowledge of GDPR and ethical data practices, including anonymisation.
Evidence of using data for meaningful insights and change.
Anti-racist and anti-oppressive practice commitment.
Strong communication skills, able to work with non-analytical colleagues and translate requirements into analysis.
Passion for organisational learning and data literacy.
Desirable
Experience designing surveys, qualitative interviews, or creative data collection.
Excellent report writing and presentation skills.
Familiarity with social sector data (youth justice, education, social care).
Salesforce CRM experience.
Experience writing funding applications.




Additional requirements




Right to work in the UK.
Subject to DBS check.




Not sure you meet every requirement? We encourage you to apply even if you don’t match the description exactly. Tell us about your achievements, what you've learned, and how your passion and skills could contribute to SHiFT.




We look forward to hearing from you!

Show more

Experience & skills (essential)
  • Degree-level (or equivalent experience) in a relevant field (e.g., research, sociology, criminology, policy).
  • Strong data management and analysis skills (Excel, Power BI, ideally Salesforce).
  • Experience with data entry, cleaning, and quality assurance.
  • Experience in data visualisation and dashboard design.
  • Knowledge of GDPR and ethical data practices, including anonymisation.
  • Evidence of using data for meaningful insights and change.
  • Anti-racist and anti-oppressive practice commitment.
  • Strong communication skills, able to work with non-analytical colleagues and translate requirements into analysis.
  • Passion for organisational learning and data literacy.
Desirable
  • Experience designing surveys, qualitative interviews, or creative data collection.
  • Excellent report writing and presentation skills.
  • Familiarity with social sector data (youth justice, education, social care).
  • Salesforce CRM experience.
  • Experience writing funding applications.


Additional requirements


  • Right to work in the UK.
  • Subject to DBS check.


Not sure you meet every requirement? We encourage you to apply even if you don’t match the description exactly. Tell us about your achievements, what you've learned, and how your passion and skills could contribute to SHiFT.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
APPLY HERE: Data Analyst




Division – Payments and Digital Assets
Department - Cross-cutting Market Analysis and Strategy
Salary - National (Edinburgh and Leeds) ranging from £52,400 to £61,800 and London £57,700 to £68,000 per annum (Salary offered will be based on skills and experience)




About the FCA

The FCA regulates the conduct of 45,000 firms in the UK to ensure our financial markets are honest, fair and competitive. Follow this link to find out more About the FCA.

Are you interested in becoming part of a new data team that will help shape and deliver the future direction of the Payments and Digital Assets Directorate at the FCA? We are looking for motivated Senior Associates to join the Cross-cutting Market Analysis and Strategy department within this Directorate.

This department plays a key role in defining the FCA’s strategies for payments and digital assets. It supports on designing and delivering the data strategy, identifying and managing risk, providing training, engaging externally, scanning the horizon and proactively identifying trends, among other responsibilities. This is a fantastic opportunity to make an impact in the evolving world of payments and digital assets, while building deep expertise in these dynamic sectors.




What will you be doing?

Present data analysis outcomes clearly and effectively, including to senior stakeholders, using impactful data visualisation techniques and tools to support choices
Design and deliver data collection and evaluation initiatives aligned with the FCA’s strategy for payments and digital assets, using both proprietary and open-source tools
Collaborate across teams to develop and maintain dashboards with agreed metrics that support strategic and operational objectives
Proactively identify opportunities to apply data evaluation and visualisation to support key projects and priorities across the Directorate
Develop and implement advanced data-driven solutions that align with the central data management policy, support cultural change in data use and provide training to enhance data literacy




What will you get from the role?

Experience in a fast-paced, evolving tech environment with a focus on building innovative solutions and encouraging AI-driven ideas
Involved in central data initiatives, wider cross-functional data projects, PSR-related work and digital transformation in payments
Contributed to strategic growth plans while collaborating with government and regulatory bodies as part of a newly formed team
Work widely recognised and appreciated for driving meaningful impact in data-related initiatives




Which skills are required?

We are a Disability Confident Employer; therefore, disabled people or individuals with long-term conditions who best meet the minimum criteria for a role will go through to the next stage of the recruitment process. (To learn more about the Disability Confident Scheme Click Here)




Minimum

Experience of using Excel, SQL, R, Python, Tableau or other data analytics tools to interrogate, manipulate and evaluate data
Experience in utilising data analysis for the delivery of departmental priorities
Experience in Stakeholder Management




Essential

Strong reasoning skills with the ability to quickly grasp new information, understand complex issues and clearly communicate their implications
Knowledge of the payments or digital assets sector, with a proactive and adaptable approach to learning
Proven experience in creating data visualisation dashboards (e.g., using Tableau) and applying analytical skills to support sound, balanced choices
Excellent stakeholder and relationship management, along with strong project management experience
Ability to work at pace under pressure, demonstrating sound judgment and appropriately escalating issues when needed
Comfortable managing ambiguity and competing priorities, working independently or as part of a team across multiple workstreams




Our Values & Diversity

We are proud to be an inclusive employer and our ambition is to cultivate a culture for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views and experiences. We believe that our differences and similarities enable us to be a better organisation – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better regulation.

Within the workplace you will have access to various employee resource groups which aim to promote and achieve a healthy work / life balance and support our diversity ambitions.

Did you know? 50% of our Executive Committee were the first in their family to attend university.




Benefits of working at the FCA

25 days holiday per year plus bank holidays
Hybrid working (work from home up to 60% of your time)
Private healthcare with Bupa
A non-contributory Pension of at least 8% of basic salary each month (there are several contribution levels that increase depending on your age – up to 12% a month once you reach age 35)
Life assurance of eight times your basic salary
Income protection

We also have a competitive flexible benefits scheme which gives you the opportunity to create a personalised benefits package, tailored to suit your lifestyle.

We welcome applications from candidates who are looking for flexible arrangements. Many of our staff work flexibly including working part-time, staggered hours and job shares. We can’t promise to give you exactly what you want but we can explore what might work best for both sides.

Follow this link to see what life is like at the FCA - Life at the FCA




Application Support

We are dedicated to removing barriers and ensuring our application process is accessible to everyone. We offer a range of adjustments to make your application experience as comfortable and straightforward as possible.

If you have an accessibility need, disability or condition requiring changes to the recruitment process, please contact your recruiter using the details below and they will be happy to discuss this further with you.




Useful Information and Timeline

This role is graded as Senior Associate – Regulatory – Level 7
Advert Closing Date: 27th July
CV Review/Shortlist: 29th July
First Round Case Study Assessment: 30th July – 6th August
Competency Based Interview: 30th July – 6th August

Your Recruiter will discuss the process in detail with you during screening for the role, therefore, please make them aware if you are going to be unavailable for any date during this time.




We are proud supporters of Women in Data. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.

Stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities and more.

We are looking for motivated Senior Associates to join the Cross-cutting Market Analysis and Strategy department within this Directorate.

This department plays a key role in defining the FCA’s strategies for payments and digital assets. It supports on designing and delivering the data strategy, identifying and managing risk, providing training, engaging externally, scanning the horizon and proactively identifying trends, among other responsibilities. This is a fantastic opportunity to make an impact in the evolving world of payments and digital assets, while building deep expertise in these dynamic sectors.


What will you be doing?

  • Present data analysis outcomes clearly and effectively, including to senior stakeholders, using impactful data visualisation techniques and tools to support choices
  • Design and deliver data collection and evaluation initiatives aligned with the FCA’s strategy for payments and digital assets, using both proprietary and open-source tools
  • Collaborate across teams to develop and maintain dashboards with agreed metrics that support strategic and operational objectives
  • Proactively identify opportunities to apply data evaluation and visualisation to support key projects and priorities across the Directorate
  • Develop and implement advanced data-driven solutions that align with the central data management policy, support cultural change in data use and provide training to enhance data literacy


What will you get from the role?

  • Experience in a fast-paced, evolving tech environment with a focus on building innovative solutions and encouraging AI-driven ideas
  • Involved in central data initiatives, wider cross-functional data projects, PSR-related work and digital transformation in payments
  • Contributed to strategic growth plans while collaborating with government and regulatory bodies as part of a newly formed team
  • Work widely recognised and appreciated for driving meaningful impact in data-related initiatives


Which skills are required?

We are a Disability Confident Employer; therefore, disabled people or individuals with long-term conditions who best meet the minimum criteria for a role will go through to the next stage of the recruitment process. (To learn more about the Disability Confident Scheme Click Here)


Minimum

  • Experience of using Excel, SQL, R, Python, Tableau or other data analytics tools to interrogate, manipulate and evaluate data
  • Experience in utilising data analysis for the delivery of departmental priorities
  • Experience in Stakeholder Management


Essential

  • Strong reasoning skills with the ability to quickly grasp new information, understand complex issues and clearly communicate their implications
  • Knowledge of the payments or digital assets sector, with a proactive and adaptable approach to learning
  • Proven experience in creating data visualisation dashboards (e.g., using Tableau) and applying analytical skills to support sound, balanced choices
  • Excellent stakeholder and relationship management, along with strong project management experience
  • Ability to work at pace under pressure, demonstrating sound judgment and appropriately escalating issues when needed
  • Comfortable managing ambiguity and competing priorities, working independently or as part of a team across multiple workstreams


Our Values & Diversity

We are proud to be an inclusive employer and our ambition is to cultivate a culture for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views and experiences. We believe that our differences and similarities enable us to be a better organisation – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better regulation.

Within the workplace you will have access to various employee resource groups which aim to promote and achieve a healthy work / life balance and support our diversity ambitions.

Did you know? 50% of our Executive Committee were the first in their family to attend university.


Benefits of working at the FCA

  • 25 days holiday per year plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working (work from home up to 60% of your time)
  • Private healthcare with Bupa
  • A non-contributory Pension of at least 8% of basic salary each month (there are several contribution levels that increase depending on your age – up to 12% a month once you reach age 35)
  • Life assurance of eight times your basic salary
  • Income protection

We also have a competitive flexible benefits scheme which gives you the opportunity to create a personalised benefits package, tailored to suit your lifestyle.

We welcome applications from candidates who are looking for flexible arrangements. Many of our staff work flexibly including working part-time, staggered hours and job shares. We can’t promise to give you exactly what you want but we can explore what might work best for both sides.

Follow this link to see what life is like at the FCA - Life at the FCA


Application Support

We are dedicated to removing barriers and ensuring our application process is accessible to everyone. We offer a range of adjustments to make your application experience as comfortable and straightforward as possible.

If you have an accessibility need, disability or condition requiring changes to the recruitment process, please contact your recruiter using the details below and they will be happy to discuss this further with you.


Useful Information and Timeline

  • This role is graded as Senior Associate – Regulatory – Level 7
  • Advert Closing Date: 27th July
  • CV Review/Shortlist: 29th July
  • First Round Case Study Assessment: 30th July – 6th August
  • Competency Based Interview: 30th July – 6th August

Your Recruiter will discuss the process in detail with you during screening for the role, therefore, please make them aware if you are going to be unavailable for any date during this time.


We are proud supporters of Women in Data. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.

Stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities and more.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
About Tilt🛸

We’re reinventing shopping for the 21st century—bringing joy, connection, and a splash of chaos back to e-commerce. Tilt is the UK’s biggest live shopping platform, and we’re just getting started. We raised an $18M Series A and are building a world-class team across ops, product, and finance.

Now we’re looking for a sharp, organised, and ambitious Finance Analyst to join our small but mighty finance team and help us scale our processes, visibility, and impact.

Your Mission 🧾

You’ll be the analytical muscle of the finance function—building tools, models, and dashboards that turn Tilt’s numbers into action. From revenue deep dives to budget performance, investor metrics to scenario planning, you’ll help elevate the visibility and sophistication of our financial operations.

You’ll work closely with our Finance Lead and collaborate across Data, Marketing, Ops, and Product. This is a rare opportunity to apply your analytical skills in a fast-paced environment with tangible commercial impact.

What You’ll Do 👷

0–3 Months


Build foundational reporting on revenue, spend, margin, and contribution
Design and maintain dashboards to track financial KPIs across the business
Reconcile financial and operational data between systems (Shopify, Xero, banks, etc.)
Analyse campaign performance, customer behaviour, and cohort trends
Support board and investor reporting with timely and accurate data
Assist with variance analysis and financial insight generation


3+ Months


Develop models for forecasting, scenario planning, and headcount planning
Lead financial deep dives across LTV, CAC, channel performance, and unit economics
Collaborate with engineering to improve data flows and reduce manual reporting
Build budget tracking and self-serve tooling for department leads
Automate recurring reporting workflows using SQL, Python, or BI tools
Champion data integrity and drive adoption of finance analytics across teams


What We’re Looking For ✅


1–3 years of experience in a data, analytics, or finance-focused role (startup or high-growth background a plus)
Confident in SQL, spreadsheets, and turning raw data into usable insight
Familiarity with financial concepts—revenue recognition, margin, opex/capex
Exposure to tools like Xero, Airbank, Shopify, or equivalent platforms
Bonus: experience with forecasting models or financial scenario planning
Strong attention to detail, with a bias toward automation and clarity
Self-starter who’s excited by fast feedback loops and real commercial impact


Expected start date is August 15th or sooner

Perks & Benefits ➕

Including the advertised compensation range, we offer:


Truly flexible hours—work when you’re at your best
29 days PTO (plus UK Bank Holidays)
Tech & office budget to get your workspace just right
All the AI tools you need—we’ll cover subscriptions like Cursor
Remote work options—we’re flexible where it counts
Free Deliveroo for late working evenings
Canary Wharf office with free gym membership
Matched pension contributions
Work abroad for up to 14 consecutive days a year


We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences, and we’re committed to fostering an inclusive, diverse workplace.

If you don’t meet every single requirement in the job description, please don’t be put off from applying. We value potential and a willingness to learn over ticking every box — your unique perspective could be exactly what we’re looking for.

Let us know if you need any adjustments during the application process — we’re happy to help.

Compensation Range: £35K - £50K

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join a well-established Investment Manager. This role is suited to someone with strong data handling skills, experience with Python and generative AI, and a background in financial services.




Key Responsibilities:

Investigate and resolve a range of data issues
Analyse large datasets using Excel and Python
Support the implementation of system changes and upgrades
Collaborate with internal teams including Investment, IT, Risk, and Performance
Apply generative AI techniques to improve processes and efficiency
Ensure systems deliver accurate, complete, and timely data to internal users and clients
Contribute to operational risk management and project delivery




Requirements:

To be considered, candidates must have strong data literacy and advanced Excel skills, gained within a financial services environment. Proficiency in Python and demonstrable experience with generative AI tools or techniques are essential. The ideal candidate will have 1–2 years of relevant experience and hold a degree in a STEM or Finance-related discipline.




This is a great opportunity for someone who is comfortable working with complex data in a regulated environment and is motivated to apply emerging technologies to real-world operational challenges. Please note the client is not able to offer visa sponsorship for this position.

Title: Associate Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Bentley Systems. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Associate Data Quality Analyst

Location: Ireland and UK (Office/Hybrid/ Remote)

Position Summary

Bentley Systems is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Associate Data Quality Analyst to join our Data Advancement Team within the Data Operations Organization. This is an excellent opportunity for an aspiring data professional to launch their career and gain hands-on experience in a critical area of our business.

We're seeking someone with a solid foundation in data quality principles and a strong desire to learn. If you're passionate about data, have a keen eye for detail, and are eager to contribute to a collaborative and innovative team, we encourage you to apply. This role presents a fantastic opportunity to develop your skills and advance within a leading technology company.

We Will Rely On You For The Following


Ensure ongoing compliance with quality and industry regulatory requirements
Ensure that user expectations are met during the testing process
Recommend, implement, and monitor preventative and corrective actions to ensure that quality assurance standards are achieved
Identify and remedy defects within the production process
Implement and monitor test scripts to assess functionality, reliability, performance, and quality of the service or product.
Document SOX processes and be the point of contact for audits


What You Bring To The Team


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
Meticulous attention to detail
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Analytic and problem-solving abilities
Ability to provide accurate and comprehensive feedback to colleagues


What Would Make You Stand Out


knowledge of SQL
Familiarity with Power BI
Familiarity with data warehousing platforms (i.e. Snowflake, Azure Data Warehouse, etc.)
Familiarity with analytics platforms (i.e. Spark, Databricks, etc.)
Knowledge/Experience with Scripting languages such as Python
Good understanding of code repositories such as GIT


What We Offer


A great Team and culture – please see our Recruitment Video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=epJImnDsbYE) .
An exciting career as an integral part of a world-leading software company providing solutions for architecture, engineering, and construction.
Competitive Salary and benefits.
The opportunity to work within a global and diverse international team.
A supportive and collaborative environment.
Colleague Recognition Awards.


 About Bentley Systems

Around the world, infrastructure professionals rely on software from Bentley Systems to help them design, build, and operate better and more resilient infrastructure for transportation, water, energy, cities, and more. Founded in 1984 by engineers for engineers, Bentley is the partner of choice for engineering firms and owner-operators worldwide, with software that spans engineering disciplines, industry sectors, and all phases of the infrastructure lifecycle. Through our digital twin solutions, we help infrastructure professionals unlock the value of their data to transform project delivery and asset performance. www.bentley.com

Equal Opportunity Employer

Bentley is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers for employment all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, religion/belief, national origin, caste, age, or any other characteristic protected by local law or unrelated to job qualifications.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Data Analyst Associate (Entry Level)
Description:
Job_Summary:

General Dynamics Information Technology is an IT consulting company that specializes in cyber security, AI, and quantum computing. As a Data Analyst Associate, you will provide insights to help clients turn data into action, addressing big-data challenges and supporting IT Service Management initiatives.




Responsibilities:

• Maintain all documentation related to Problem Management process including policies, procedures, and work instructions, while ensuring that IT best practices are implemented and enforced through a strong understanding of current company processes

• Lead cross-functional coordination between service organizations and drives all actions for end-to-end resolution of each problem

• Advises senior and executive leadership on potential gaps in processes identified through persistent occurrences of the same problem and resulting in potential performance impacts to SLA

• Establish deadlines for ownership of actions to include verbal and written communication to the client according to standard operating procedures outlined within the contract

• Performs initial reviews of all FACARs (Failure Analysis and Corrective Action Reports) for accuracy, subject matter and constructive feedback prior to delivery and reporting up to senior and executive leadership

• Manages daily and weekly and monthly tracking of all open problems up to the point of successful closure

• Performs historical analysis of Major incidents and Problem Records for reoccurring INCIDENTS to ensure accountability of service improvement and corrective actions are being followed to ensure a resolution is reached in coordination with owners

• Communicates problem management status updates for monthly Operation Performance Reviews to senior and executive leadership

• Your success will be measured through minimized incidents and reports delivered on time according to contractual requirements




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Top Secret SCI + Polygraph clearance level must currently possess

• Top Secret SCI + Polygraph clearance level must be able to obtain

• 0+ years of related experience

• US Citizenship Required

• Bachelor of Arts/Bachelor of Science

• Strong organizational skills

• Attention to detail

• Strong written and verbal communication




-Preferred:

• Multitasking and collaboration skills




Company:

General Dynamics Information Technology is an IT consulting company that specializes in cyber security, AI, and quantum computing. It is a sub-organization of General Dynamics.

Title: Tableau Data Analyst
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Universal Technologies. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

UNIVERSAL Technologies is seeking a Tableau Data Analyst for a remote role. All consultants will be working 100% remotely, and we prefer candidates located in the EST time zone with an active LinkedIn account.

Position: The Tableau Data Analyst will be responsible for gathering and analyzing data, building complex dashboards using Tableau, and supporting data-driven initiatives. The consultant will develop and maintain data visualizations to support decision-making across departments, ensuring data accuracy and providing actionable insights. This role requires collaboration with various teams and interaction with vendors to drive business outcomes through data-driven insights.

Who We Are

UNIVERSAL Technologies, LLC is a Women-Owned (M/WBE) IT solutions and consulting company focused on delivering enterprise systems that significantly improve our clients' IT performance. We work across the IT spectrum, including Development, Business/Systems/Data Analysis, Project Management, Cyber Security, Network Engineering, and High-Level System Architecture.

The pride in the services we provide and the accessibility and flexibility we offer to employees are what make Universal Technologies stand out! We aim to propel your IT career to the next level and excite our employees with new and challenging projects.

What We Offer

Our W2 employees can expect the following benefits:


Competitive pay
Health/Dental Insurance
Group Life Insurance
401K
HSA/FSA
Pre-Tax Transportation Program
Generous Paid Time Off/Holiday Policy


Mandatory Skills/Experience


Proven experience in building complex and interactive dashboards using Tableau Desktop.
Experience analyzing Salesforce data and interacting with Standard and Custom Objects.
Developing custom SQL queries using SOQL for data extraction to Tableau.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable business insights.
Experience translating business requirements into effective data visualizations that support decision-making.
Ability to design and develop visualizations that convey business insights clearly and effectively.
Experience managing and maintaining Tableau Server environments, including user access control, data security, and performance monitoring.
Expertise in creating calculated fields, leveraging table calculations, and using LOD (Level of Detail) expressions for advanced analysis.
Experience working with Power BI and using DAX and M for ETL processes, including integrating data from different sources.
Familiarity with data modeling techniques, including star schema, snowflake schema, and dimensional modeling.
Knowledge of scripting languages like Python or R for advanced analytics or integration with Tableau.
Experience handling and analyzing large and complex datasets from multiple sources.
Experience working directly with stakeholders and collaborating with business teams to understand data needs, gather business requirements, and translate them into functional BI reports and dashboards.
A meticulous eye for detail to ensure data accuracy and visualization quality, as well as the ability to spot trends and anomalies.
Strong desire to promote data literacy within the organization, supporting other team members in understanding and leveraging dashboards for their roles.


Scope Of Services


Gather and collect data from various business processing systems and customer service platforms.
Ensure data accuracy and completeness through meticulous cleaning and preprocessing.
Apply analytical methods to interpret data, uncovering trends, patterns, and correlations that offer valuable insights for decision-making.
Develop visually compelling and informative data visualizations, including charts, graphs, and dashboards using Tableau.
Collaborate with teams across departments, providing analytical support and generating actionable reports and recommendations.
Adapt to new technologies and methodologies essential for maintaining data integrity and driving business outcomes through data-driven insights.


Desirable Skills/Experience


Strong understanding of Salesforce Data model (Preferred).
Tableau Desktop Specialist, Tableau Certified Associate, or Tableau Server Certified Associate (Preferred).
Knowledge of predictive analytics or machine learning models integrated into Tableau for advanced use cases (Preferred).


Special Requirements


Experience managing projects and meeting deadlines.
Ability to approach data-related challenges logically and develop creative solutions.


UNIVERSAL Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

  • Experience working with Power BI and using DAX and M for ETL processes, including integrating data from different sources.
  • Familiarity with data modeling techniques, including star schema, snowflake schema, and dimensional modeling.
  • Knowledge of scripting languages like Python or R for advanced analytics or integration with Tableau.
  • Experience handling and analyzing large and complex datasets from multiple sources.
  • Experience working directly with stakeholders and collaborating with business teams to understand data needs, gather business requirements, and translate them into functional BI reports and dashboards.
  • A meticulous eye for detail to ensure data accuracy and visualization quality, as well as the ability to spot trends and anomalies.
  • Strong desire to promote data literacy within the organization, supporting other team members in understanding and leveraging dashboards for their roles.

Scope Of Services

  • Gather and collect data from various business processing systems and customer service platforms.
  • Ensure data accuracy and completeness through meticulous cleaning and preprocessing.
  • Apply analytical methods to interpret data, uncovering trends, patterns, and correlations that offer valuable insights for decision-making.
  • Develop visually compelling and informative data visualizations, including charts, graphs, and dashboards using Tableau.
  • Collaborate with teams across departments, providing analytical support and generating actionable reports and recommendations.
  • Adapt to new technologies and methodologies essential for maintaining data integrity and driving business outcomes through data-driven insights.

Desirable Skills/Experience

  • Strong understanding of Salesforce Data model (Preferred).
  • Tableau Desktop Specialist, Tableau Certified Associate, or Tableau Server Certified Associate (Preferred).
  • Knowledge of predictive analytics or machine learning models integrated into Tableau for advanced use cases (Preferred).

Special Requirements

  • Experience managing projects and meeting deadlines.
  • Ability to approach data-related challenges logically and develop creative solutions.

UNIVERSAL Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Data Analyst (Entry Level)
Description:
Job Summary:

American Express is a company with a rich history of innovation and a commitment to its stakeholders. They are seeking a Data Analyst to manage data transformation, analysis, and visualization to support the third-party management program, ensuring high-quality reporting and actionable insights for various stakeholders.




Responsibilities:

• Drive Analytical capabilities in support of GSM and AXP Business Units

• Analyze the existing environment and derive opportunities, recommend alternative solutions to technical problems.

• Deliver high quality and accurate results in a timely manner.

• Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic models and systems.

• Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.

• Propose and implement solutions to ad-hoc business problems, working independently to leverage data, drive insights, and presenting results in a clear and concise manner.

• Predictive Analysis and visualization

• Data mining using state-of-the-art methods.

• Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance

• Meticulous attention to details while preserving the goal and timeframe of end products

• Translate requirements into concepts and user experience design – associate with stakeholders/ business partners to enhance design suggestions.

• Drive Data strategy initiatives




Qualifications:




Required:

• 2+ years of experience in analytics.

• Bachelor’s or master’s degree relevant to the industry (other credentials will be a plus)

• Strong analytical bend and experience on analytics tools in Excel, Tableau, SQL, Alteryx etc.

• Proficiency in dealing with large quantities of complex data and ability to derive actionable insights.

• Strong communication and relationship building skills.

• Prior project management experience, with proven ability to create powerful analytics and reporting is a must.

• Proven strong performance behavior in previous role.

• Excellent Visual Design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction – experience in developing reporting solutions towards complex multi-paneled, interactive dashboards.




Preferred:

• Third-party risk reporting knowledge would be preferred.

• Ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple manner to a global audience.

• Independent and self-motivated, capable of executing under uncertainty with multiple priorities, in a fast-paced environment.




Company:

American Express is a financial services company that provides credit cards, charge cards, payment solutions, and related services. Founded in 1850, the company is headquartered in New York, New York, USA, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently Public Company.

Title: Business Intelligence Intern
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Applied Research Associates. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Description

BI Intern Responsibilities:

The Ideal Candidate Will Have An Active Interest In Researching Market Data From Industry Reports, CRM Entries And Other Sources Of Information. The Candidate Will Collaborate With Project And Product Managers, IT, And Support Intellectual Property To Products (IP2P) Leadership. The Candidate Will Work In Close Coordination With The Program Manager And IP2P Throughout All Stages Of The Project Lifecycle To Monitor And Control Project Execution. The Selected Candidate Will


Work with project managers to develop project plan documents, including necessary resources and budgets to meet project requirements.
Assist Program Manager in developing reports, documentation, and briefings about project processes.
Attend meetings with PMs, identify and record action items, and support coordination for task completion.
Assist with developing project status reports and other documentation as needed.
Organize market data into a consolidated, user-friendly database (directory) to facilitate rapid business intelligence operations by product managers.


Project Management Intern Required Qualifications


Rising junior or senior undergraduate student or graduate student
A strong interest in business, data analytics, or marketing,
Organized with excellent attention to detail, the ability to multi-task, and the capacity to change priorities quickly and work effectively under deadlines
Team player with excellent communication skills


About Us

Applied Research Associates, Inc. (ARA) is an employee-owned international research and engineering company known for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems. We employ over 2,000 professionals and continue to grow. ARA provides a broad range of technical expertise in defense, civil, and health technologies, computer software, and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement.

ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws.

For further information, please review the Know Your Rights (https://www.eeoc.gov/poster) notice from the Department of Labor.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Data Analyst II - Entry Level
Description:
Job Summary:

Lennar is a company that empowers individuals to build their future. The Data Analyst II plays a crucial role in driving data-driven decisions to enhance organizational effectiveness and efficiency, collaborating with senior analysts and IT professionals to develop and maintain data sources and reporting tools.




Responsibilities:

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data, supporting senior analysts in the creation of insightful and accurate reports.

• Provide expertise in DAX and other relevant formulas to enhance the quality and functionality of analytical reports.

• Drive data quality by validating data & metrics calculations, surfacing quality issues, documenting metadata, and remediating data quality issues

• Participate in regular code reviews, promoting engineering best practices, including reuse and testing

• Collaborate with IT professionals to learn and adopt enterprise strategies and best practices.

• Manage the seamless promotion of reports and code to production utilizing dbt and GitHub, ensuring a robust and efficient deployment process.

• Contribute to the development and maintenance of data-related best practices, documentation, and quality assurance processes.

• Actively participate in troubleshooting and issue resolution related to data, code, and report generation.




Qualifications:




Required:

• 2-5+ years of experience in data analysis, data wrangling, and data visualization.

• 2-5+ years of proficiency in SQL for data extraction and analysis.

• Experience analyzing and breaking down problems and information using structured frameworks and methodologies.

• Expertise cleansing and integrating data from disparate data sources

• Ability and willingness to quickly learn new technologies

• Undergraduate degree in data analytics, mathematics, statistics, engineering or equivalent field, or equivalent experience.

• Experience at working as a collaborator in a team-oriented environment is essential.

• Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

• Self-driven to explore and bring new ideas as well driven to help others.

• Reacts to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently.

• Flexible during times of change.

• Ability to read communication styles of team members and contractors who come from a broad spectrum of disciplines.

• Persuasive, encouraging and motivating.

• Strong written and oral communication skills.

• Strong interpersonal and operational skill sets.

• Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products – strong analytics skills.

• Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.

• Strong Customer Service skills and focus required.

• Tenacious, driven, energetic and a high degree of professional integrity.

• Knowledge of data processes, tools, and applications.

• Ability to successfully engage and establish cooperative working relationships with others, both externally and internally.

• Ability to influence decision-makers through fact-based analysis and persuasive communication.

• Robust skills in documentation creation, data analysis and mapping, SQL query writing with a high attention to detail including planning and organization.

• Strong experience in requirements gathering and documentation with an ability to focus on business priorities and imperatives.

• Advanced skills in MS Excel including use of pivot tables and VB macros.

• Position requires reliable, consistent, and punctual attendance.

• Experience working with large datasets and complex data environments.

• Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and tools.




Preferred:

• Certification in Power BI or similar tools

• Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud




Company:

One of the Nation's leading homebuilders providing homes for first-time, move-up, luxury, urban and active adult buyers. Founded in 1954, the company is headquartered in Miami, Florida, USA, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently Public Company. Lennar has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: DATA GOVERNANCE ANALYST - REMOTE
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Compass Group, North America. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Compass Digital

Salary: $100,000 - $115,000

We are Compass Digital—the digital and technology arm of Compass Group North America. We build and scale digital products and technologies to exceed the expectations of our guests and clients. Backed by research, we create remarkable user experiences with increased choice and convenience. We offer end-to-end solutions, simultaneously boosting sales and guest satisfaction.

Compass Digital was developed from within Compass Group, focusing on driving transformation and innovation in the hospitality spaces across Business & Industry, Education, and Healthcare. We power digital in the hospitality experience, ensuring that each touchpoint is optimized for guest satisfaction while leveraging data to achieve additional outcomes.

We are fully integrated into Compass Group, proudly serving its’ various clients through scalable, cutting-edge technologies and solutions.

Job Summary

The Data Governance Analyst plays a key role in executing the organization's data governance strategy by supporting data quality initiatives, ensuring regulatory compliance, and enabling accurate, trustworthy data across the enterprise. This role will collaborate with stakeholders across business and IT, focusing on data assessment, validation, issue resolution, continuous improvement through automation and education, while enabling data-driven decision-making and AI capabilities across the enterprise.

Key Responsibilities

Data Quality & Validation


Conduct data quality assessments to evaluate accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Develop and implement data validation and testing procedures for critical data elements (CDEs).
Drive data quality improvement initiatives, including profiling and cleansing.
Support root cause analysis for recurring data issues and implement corrective actions.


Monitoring & Reporting


Design and maintain data quality dashboards and exception reports.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to data health and governance activities.
Track and report on data governance metrics to management and stakeholders.


Stakeholder Engagement


Collaborate with data owners, stewards, and technical teams to resolve data issues.
Facilitate cross-functional meetings to support data initiatives and drive accountability.
Build awareness and advocate for data governance best practices across the enterprise.


Governance Support


Provide operational support for data governance tools and workflows.
Assist in maintaining metadata repositories, data dictionaries, and lineage documentation.
Contribute to the development and alignment of data governance standards and policies.


Automation & Tooling


Leverage DQ tools and automation (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Ataccama) for profiling and remediation.
Contribute to the implementation and enhancement of governance platforms.


Compliance & Documentation


Ensure alignment with regulatory requirements (e.g., CCPA, GDPR, HIPAA).
Maintain clear, comprehensive documentation of data quality processes and findings.
Deliver training and awareness sessions for business users and data stewards.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data governance, data quality, or business analysis.
Experience with data governance and DQ tools (e.g., Informatica DQ, Collibra, Alation, Secoda).
Solid understanding of data management principles, compliance standards, and root cause analysis techniques.
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Proficiency in SQL and data profiling techniques preferred.

Title: SOCIAL MEDIA DATA ANALYST
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Ingenia Agency. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Requisitos

Experiencia en análisis de redes sociales o analítica digital.

Dominio de Excel/Google Sheets.

Conocimiento sólido de métricas orgánicas vs. pagadas.

Capacidad para traducir datos complejos en insights simples y accionables.

Fluidez al presentar datos.

Apasionado por los datos y encontrar patrones.

Resolutivo, capaz de detectar tendencias antes que otros.

Trabajo en equipo.

Analista De Datos En Redes Sociales Orientado a Resultados Para Transformar Métricas En Insights Accionables Para Marcas AAA. Responsabilidades Clave

Análisis de Desempeño y Reportes


Monitorear y analizar KPIs (engagement, alcance, etc.) en todas las plataformas.
Generar reportes semanales/mensuales con insights accionables para clientes y equipos internos.
Identificar tendencias, anomalías y oportunidades de crecimiento usando herramientas como: Meta Business, Sprinklr, Hootsuite, Emplifi, TikTok Analytics, LinkedIn Insights, etc.


Insights de Audiencia y Competencia


Analizar demográficos, comportamiento y segmentación de audiencias.
Comparar desempeño frente a competidores y estándares de la industria.
Proponer estrategias de contenido basadas en tendencias de datos.


Monitoreo y Social Listening


Uso de herramientas de Social Listening para análisis de conversación. Creación de reportes.
Configurar dashboards para seguimiento en vivo de campañas.
Identificar contenido de bajo rendimiento y sugerir optimizaciones inmediatas.
Detectar anomalías (ej. caída repentina de engagement) y escalar si es necesario.
