As part of our total rewards package, employees may also be eligible for our annual incentive program, subject to program eligibility requirements.


Posting Deadline: Posted until filled


A career at Vancity is more than just a job, you’re joining a tradition of change-makers who are creating lasting change for our communities. Beyond base pay, we offer a comprehensive total rewards package to ensure our employees are empowered to thrive:


We offer:

  • We are the largest private-sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and have been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada.
  • Our permanent employees qualify for attractive benefit packages that can be customized and changed each year to meet their evolving needs.
  • New employees receive between three to four weeks of vacation allowance per calendar year, and the number of vacation days grows
  • In addition to the 10 statutory holidays in British Columbia, Vancity provides an additional three statutory holidays. We offer care days for periods of short-term personal illness or emergency family illness.
  • We have flex credits for our health care & dental benefits offer three levels of coverage for you to select from. These benefits will also be effective immediately based on your hire date.
  • We understand that retirement means different things to different people and at Vancity we will offer you a Defined benefits pension plan that pays you a retirement income for life.


At Vancity we’re committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive workplace to help our people and communities thrive and prosper. Diversity in our workforce is integral so that we can truly represent, understand and respond to our community needs and deliver on our member experience.


We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruitment experience for all candidates. If you require any accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at recruitment@vancity.com for confidential support. In-person assistance is also available. We will collaborate with you to ensure your needs are met promptly and effectively.

Title: Demographic Analyst
Description:
ABOUT UNIVERUS:

Univerus is a global software company that unites industry-leading solutions on a single, intuitive platform. Headquartered in Port Moody, British Columbia, we serve over 3,500 clients across eight countries. Our mission is to simplify complex operations by providing scalable, user-friendly technology that empowers organizations in local government, utilities, education, manufacturing, recruitment, sport and recreation, and more.

At Univerus, we believe in the power of connection – between people, technology, and communities. Our team is passionate about delivering innovative solutions that help our customers achieve meaningful outcomes while building a workplace where employees can grow, thrive, and make an impact.

Learn more at univerus.com.

ABOUT BARAGAR SYSTEMS (a Univerus Company):

Baragar Systems’ corporate philosophy is to stay ahead of the curve with respect to the education space. With over 40 years of innovation and commitment to excellence, Baragar is the industry leader in School District planning software and services.

School district planning is complex and traditionally is a very reactive process. Baragar Systems’ mission is to empower clients to move towards proactive planning that addresses the needs of all stakeholders, and facilitates data-driven, confidence-inspiring processes.

At Baragar, innovation is the way we do business. It starts with the way we perform internal processes, development, and data production. We take the lessons that we’ve learned and apply them to the solutions we develop for our clients, both on the business and the education sides.

Learn more at baragar.com.

ROLE OVERVIEW

The Demographic Analyst supports both internal tool development and client-facing services, with a strong focus on data accuracy, projections, and improving analytical methodologies. This role contributes to the ongoing enhancement of Baragar’s software solutions by developing population and enrolment projections, refining workflows, and providing responsive client support.

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIP


Reports to the Data Analytics Manager
Coordinates with all other members of the Analytics Team
Close working relationship with the Data Warehouse Team and GIS Team for the maintenance and production of data for Baragar software updates, the Research and Development Team for updates to internal and external tools, and the Customer Support Team for client support
Serves as the primary contact for:
Demographic Dynamics (DD) software support
Reviewing projection assumptions with clients
Investigation and resolution of client issues related to DD

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Analyze demographic and enrolment data
Develop and refine population and enrolment projections
Test and troubleshoot DD software
Assist with internal tool development and testing
Communicate with clients through written and verbal channels
Create and manage Jira entries and project documentation
Conduct research on methodology improvements and process innovation
Collaborate cross-functionally to support data integrity and software enhancements Support other internal teams as required


KEY MEASUREMENTS

Productivity & Delivery


Timely completion of assigned tasks
Ability to work independently and manage workload effectively


Quality & Accuracy


High attention to detail in data analysis and projections
Accuracy in demographic reporting and assumptions


Collaboration & Communication


Active contribution to team goals and projects
Clear and professional communication with clients and internal teams


Innovation & Problem Solving


Proactive identification and resolution of issues
Contribution to improving methodologies, tools, and workflows


REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES


Efficiency with Windows OS, file management, and Microsoft Office suite
Strong analytical thinking and data interpretation
Proficient verbal and written communication
Comfortable making decisions with incomplete data
High attention to detail and quality control
Adaptability and openness to changing priorities
Self-driven with a collaborative mindset
Client-focused and solutions-oriented


Required:

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE


Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field (e.g., Demography, Statistics, Geography, Data Science)
Minimum 1-2 years’ experience working in a related professional work environment


Highly Valued Assets:


GIS Certificate or related experience
Strong MS Excel skills, including VBA
Experience with:
Data transformation tools (e.g., Alteryx)
Client training (in-person or virtual)
Technical writing or documentation
Product specification and planning
Educational administration or planning
Programming, AI, or Machine Learning
Background in statistical methods or demographic projections
Experience leading small projects or teams

WHAT WE OFFER:


Health and Dental
EFAP
RRSP Matching
Paid Time Off
Flexible Work Environment
Education Reimbursement Program
Show more

Title: Senior Operations Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Your opportunity

By joining the Kardium team, you can help make a difference in the lives of millions around the world. We have developed a ground-breaking medical device for the minimally invasive diagnosis and treatment of the most common heart rhythm disorder, atrial fibrillation. Atrial fibrillation can cause stroke, heart failure, and other heart-related complications.

Kardium has a fantastic technical team that has developed a product with strong, unique and customer-valued differentiators versus other solutions on the market: The Globe® Pulsed Field System. We have built connections with key opinion leaders who are already using the Globe System and are helping to tell our story.

As an Operational Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high-impact dashboards, metrics and reporting across various operational teams. You will play a critical role in enabling real-time operational visibility and data-informed decision-making, supporting both daily execution and strategic planning initiatives. The analyst will work cross-functionally with operations, purchasing, and quality teams, with a strong focus on data quality and continuity during our transition to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP system.

Please note, this opportunity is a hybrid work arrangement, located in Burnaby, BC.

Meaningful work you will be part of

 

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Develop and maintain critical operational metrics and key process indicators (KPIs) to support manufacturing, planning, and quality functions
Create and manage visual dashboards to provide real time insight into operational performance using tools such as Power BI and Excel
Provide analytical support for continuous improvement initiatives and projects to identify and prioritize optimization opportunities for cost reduction and performance improvements.
Query and extract relevant data from ERP and other data sources using SQL or other relevant tools.
Partner with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and alignment with operational goals
Collaborate with stakeholders to develop scalable reporting frameworks and templates to support future growth.
Advise on data architecture and structure as systems evolve and new systems introduced, ensuring the right data is collected and accessible.
Lead initiatives to improve data quality and governance, identifying gaps and implementing data validation processes.
Train and support end-users in interpreting dashboard data and utilizing insights for decision-making.
Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations and company policies.


What you bring to the team

Our Kardium team is smart, creative, and passionate about developing cutting-edge medical devices to help improve people’s lives. We work in a collaborative environment based on trust and respect. We understand that only by working together can we solve what was thought unsolvable.

You are suited to our approach and possess these attributes:


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years experience in data analytics or reporting in a manufacturing or supply chain environment.
Advanced skills in Power BI, SQL and Excel.
Highly analytic and data driven with the ability to organize data and derive conclusions
Demonstrated experience building and maintaining dashboards and reporting systems used by cross-functional teams.
Strong understanding of operational process (manufacturing, supply chain) as well as key operations metrics (e.g., OEE, throughput, inventory turns, supplier performance).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experience working with ERP systems (Microsoft D365 or equivalent is a strong asset).
Knowledge and experience working in the regulated manufacturing industry is an asset.


Compensation

Kardium has listed the total cash compensation range that we expect to pay applicants for this role, as of the time of this posting. Pay offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, and business or organizational needs.


$90,000 – 120,000 (CAD Annually)


Why work at Kardium

A meaningful career working with a truly innovative technology and an ambitious team, combined with:


Knowing every day that you are making a difference in people’s lives by helping treat a condition that affects millions worldwide.
A great working environment with opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge.
An opportunity to extend your knowledge by interacting with other team members in a multi-disciplinary environment that includes electrical and mechanical engineers, biologists, and specialists in human factors, and clinical and regulatory affairs.
An engaged leadership team who believes in mentoring and growing employees’ careers.
Supportive and fun colleagues with plenty of social events to encourage people connections.
And our employees think we are great too – check out Glassdoor to learn more!


Your Benefits & Well-being

Support for you (and your dependents) overall well-being.

Life at Kardium

What makes us a great place to work?


Our Purpose
Our People
Our Culture


At Kardium, we embrace diversity of background, experience, and perspective and we’re committed to inclusion and equity at every level. We encourge applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of all communities.

We collaborate with Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), as volunteer-led groups who share a common dimension of diversity and come together to provide support, education, and other opportunities across Kardium. Examples of our ERGs include Women ERG, Pride ERG, Race Ethnicity & Cultural Heritage (REACH) ERG, Truth & Reconciliation ERG, Persian Community ERG, Chinese ERG, Barangay Kardium (Filipino) ERG, and Irish ERG.

As part of your application, we encourage you to note if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). There will be an optional section in the application form where you can provide this information to the recruitment team.

And our employees think we are great too – check out Glassdoor to learn more!

Title: Governance Analyst
Description:
Determined. Imaginative. Curious. If these are some of the ways you describe yourself — we want to learn more about you! At TC Energy, we are Energy Problem Solvers — passionate about transitioning North America to cleaner energy while meeting the energy demands of today and tomorrow. If that sounds like a challenge you want to help tackle, we want you to join our team!

The Opportunity 

TC Energy’s External Relations group in Canada is currently looking to hire a Governance Analyst, which can be based in Vancouver, B.C. or Calgary, A.B.

 

Reporting to the Manager, Strategy, Governance & Planning, this role will be critical to improving business processes that help transform the work of the External Relations Canada team. They will support the team’s strategic initiatives by identifying, analyzing, and optimizing business processes, ensuring alignment with our strategy, objectives, and technology solutions.

This role will have the ability to make a real impact by transforming the ways we work as one team and ultimately support our mission of building and sustaining support for TC Energy’s projects and operations.

   

What you’ll do  


Make things better: Analyze and document current business processes, understand real world usage and impacts, and implement improvements. Implement smarter ways to manage processes, data and information.
Solve problems: Bring a structured approach to problem-solving, a passion for process efficiency, and manage the adoption of solutions by the team.
Defend the strategy: Design governance processes that align with External Relations Canada’s strategic objectives, identify and resolve obstacles to our strategic direction, and be an internal advocate for our strategy.
Connect the dots: Work closely with stakeholders across the External Relations Canada team and collaborate with other TC Energy groups (e.g. Information Services, Finance, Legal, and related Business Units) to ensure our tools support improved processes.
Facilitate change: Support change management efforts and help teams adopt new processes and tools.
Sustain the wins: Be a champion for continuous improvement, ensuring that process improvements are effectively implemented, sustained, and refined.
Keep us organized: Develop and maintain process documentation, KPIs, and reporting products. Oversee the active tasks associated with Strategy, Governance, and Planning, ensuring that tactics are coordinated and tracking to plan.



Minimum Qualifications  


Post-secondary education (diploma or degree) in Business Administration, Information Systems, or a related field. Equivalent work experience with demonstrated expertise in business process management will also be considered
2 years of related experience in business analysis or process improvement roles
Ability to translate business needs into clear process flows and functional requirements
Strong facilitation, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and a focus on measurable outcome
Familiarity with Microsoft 365 and Power Platform environments
Exposure to Dynamics 365 or collaboration with technical teams on system-enabled process improvements



Preferred Qualifications  


Proven problem-solver who gets excited about finding better ways to do things
Knowledge of business process modeling techniques (e.g., BPMN)
Experience applying Lean, Six Sigma, or other continuous improvement methodologies
Experience working in or supporting External Relations teams and projects within the energy industry
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) to support process performance tracking
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA)



 

This position requires candidates to:  


Have current, valid authorization to work within Canada
Occasionally be available for extended work hours outside of standard business hours, call-out support and emergency support 



 

To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico.  

About Our Business

TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states.

TC Energy is an equal opportunity employer.

Learn more

Visit us at TCEnergy.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates.

Thank you for choosing TC Energy in your career search.


Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder.
Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions.
All positions require background screening. Some require criminal and/or credit checks to comply with regulations.
TC Energy is committed to provide employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@tcenergy.com.

Title: Senior Business Solutions / Data Management Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Business Solutions / Data Management Analyst

Location: Vancouver, BC (3x Onsite a week)

Employment Type: Contract Opportunity

Interview Type: Face 2 Face (Onsite Interview Only)

Job Description


Role: Senior Business Solutions / Data Management Analyst with technical/data knowledge/capabilities, especially with Database/SQL capability


Required Skills


AWS or other Cloud familiarity & experience
Expert-level SQL query writing, data structure knowledge, relational and dimensional
Expert-level data mapping capability
Expert-level data analysis capability
Excellent communication, fluency, and specificity, verbal and written
Expert-level knowledge management /documentation in Confluence or similar
Expert-level FCRM knowledge, with experience in LCTR reporting through Navaera application/interface mapping
Experience and expertise with Canadian Financial Industry, working on Navaera projects


Other Valuable Skills


Informatica IDMC knowledge
EFTR Navaera knowledge/expertise
Nice Actimize knowledge/experience
Data modeling knowledge/experience
Project management/resource coordination

Title: business systems analyst
Description:
Overview

Title: Data Engineer, Data & Analytics
Description:
Proud to be 100% Canadian-owned, Northland Properties' are recognized as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, resorts, sports, construction, and asset management. Our well-known and loved brands have been bringing people together to celebrate unforgettable experiences across Canada, the US, Ireland, and the UK for over 50 years. As Canada’s fastest-growing hospitality group, we believe the foundation of our continued success is our people and their ability to take great care of our guests.

Position Overview: Data Engineer, Data & Analytics

About Northland Northland Properties is recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, sports, and construction. Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, Shark Club Sports Bar, Portmarnock Hotel and Golf Links, Revelstoke Mountain Resort, The Dallas Stars, Grouse Mountain, Northland Asset Management Company and more to come!

Proud to be 100% Canadian-owned and operated, with over 200 outlets nationwide, locations also in the UK and USA, their home office is in Vancouver and employs over 10,000 talented individuals.

Opportunity Northland is looking for a Data Engineer who will be a part of our Data & Analytics team.

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and architectures that enable efficient data collection, transformation, and analysis across the organization.

Your work will directly support our Data & Analytics initiatives by ensuring the availability, accuracy, and integrity of data from multiple sources.

This position is based in Vancouver, Canada and will report to the Manager, Data & Analytics.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain robust ETL/ELT pipelines using modern data engineering tools (dbt, Azure Data Factory, Databricks) .
Architect and manage data warehouse and data lake solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Azure Synapse).
Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data needs.
Integrate data from diverse structured and unstructured sources (APIs, databases, cloud storage).
Ensure data quality, integrity, and governance through validation and monitoring. Apply best practices in security, compliance, and privacy for sensitive datasets.
Optimize queries and data models for performance and scalability.
Implement and maintain data infrastructure in cloud environments (e.g., Azure).
Create and maintain documentation related to data architecture, lineage, and technical flows.
Maintain code and data repositories.
Support business analysts when developing project plans, identifying scope, defining deliverables, planning milestones and status updates, establishing proper communication, and mitigating any roadblocks.


Skills & Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management of Technology, Information Systems, or equivalent work experience
At least three years of experience in the data field.
Proficiency in SQL
Experience working on Data projects; Understanding of data management, data modeling, BI and analytics concepts.
Experience with ETL/ELT pipelines and Medallion architecture.
Experience with Cloud Data Services and Big Data tools & technologies. Experience with the following specific technologies is a plus:
Snowflake
dbt
Databricks
Azure (ADF, ADLSgen2, Container Instances)
Microsoft Power Platform
Exposure to both Agile & waterfall frameworks.
Experience in the hospitality field is a plus

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities; however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

At Northland Properties, we are committed to building a network of talented professionals who can help to provide exceptional hospitality experiences. As an equal opportunity employer, we are constantly seeking motivated and enthusiastic individuals to join us in various fields, including Construction, Finance, IT, HR, Marketing, and Support Center. To join our dedicated team and be a part of our thriving hospitality community, explore the exciting career opportunities available at https://northland.ca/careers/.

Title: Quantitative Equity Analyst – Data Science
Description:
Quantitative Equity Analyst – Data Science

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd.

Vancouver, BC

We are looking for a Quantitative Equity Analyst to join our Quantitative Equity Team! We are a high-performance team embedded in a top-performing quant fund, dedicated to the mission-critical operation of our investment engine—a well-tuned machine responsible for generating key decisions that drive trades and investment insights. Leveraging finance skills and cutting-edge technology, we ensure data quality, continuous process improvement, and operational excellence.

As a core member of our team, you'll collaborate with investment experts to tackle challenging analytical problems, be accountable to ensure accurate and timely trade generation, and drive operational innovation. Based in West Coast Vancouver, we value mentorship, collaboration, and growth in a supportive and innovative environment. Join us to make a significant impact on our investment engine and overall success.

What You Will Do

This is an exciting full-time role for individuals who are passionate about learning the quantitative equity investment management business and excited to tackle a broad range of investment, mathematical, and technology challenges.

You will start with a comprehensive training program, learning about various elements of quantitative equity investment management and our investment process.

You will then continue to a specialized role utilizing data science and process engineering skillsets to accelerate the Quantitative Equities Team’s various investment functions. Your specialized role may involve building, scaling, managing and/or analyzing our quantitative model, portfolios, data assets and optimizers.

You will be supported with coaching and mentorship from senior members of the team.

We are creating the conditions for you to grow your career steadily over time.

Investment Process Management

The team you will be joining is our Investment Process Management (IPM) group within our Quantitative Equities Team. IPM plays a central role in building highly scalable, efficient, and robust process management systems. The processes and infrastructure we maintain are critical in the team’s ability to develop systematic investment insights and generate daily trades to capture these insights in portfolios. The opportunity within the IPM group allows ambitious individuals to drive their career growth within IPM, or across the other functions of the Quantitative Equities Team in Research, Portfolio Construction, or Trading.

Skills

While we take the approach of tailoring the career path for the individual, we have found our functions to cover two main overarching technical skillsets:

Data Science


Construct and run algorithms to explore and assess data effectively.
Validate structured and unstructured data sets for data quality.
Design and test data loaders and security matching processes and specifications.
Perform data analysis and provide data expertise to support researcher’s projects.
Facilitate production machine learning operational pipelines with effective and timely auditing and analysis.
Enable accessibility and clarity within our data assets through robust documentation and data scrubbing.
Develop robust methodologies for assessing and analyzing data in time critical production environments.
Respond to and mitigate vendor data issues effectively in a production setting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate traditional and alternative data into existing analytical frameworks and decision-making processes.
Present findings and recommendations to key stakeholders in a clear, concise, and compelling manner.


Process and Reliability Engineering


Design, implement and test production processes to run the alpha and risk, portfolio optimization and market implementation processes.
Design robust, high performance and effective process orchestration.
Monitor production health and respond to critical issues in a timely manner.
Effectively communicate real-time production issues to portfolio managers, traders and researchers.
Identify computational bottle necks and improve run speeds in production systems.
Collaborate with investment teams to ensure their process needs are being met.
Find and evaluate areas for process improvements.
Assess and evaluate data quality of production processes.
Maintain process repos, clean code and tools within production processes.


Reasons to Grow Your Career with Us


Impact – We help create opportunities for you to leverage your personal strengths to make a positive impact on our business.
Culture – Collaboration and innovation are deeply rooted in our culture. We enjoy working together and align our passions in pursuit of a shared objective in every project we undertake.
Development – We create conditions for success tailored to each employee through internally developed career development plans.
Mentorship – We believe that developing great people is the key to great success. You will have opportunities to share, hear and learn about career experiences from peers and senior team members.
Work-Life Balance – Vancouver is surrounded by water, mountains, and cherry blossoms. We work hard in our professional lives but also create space to enjoy our personal lives.


What You Bring


Analytical Mindset – You think critically and creatively and are adept at balancing intuition with statistical validation.
Financial Knowledge – You possess a thorough understanding of (or strong desire to learn) key drivers of business success, including financial theory, economic models, and corporate financial statements.
Self-Starter – You are motivated and willing to take personal accountability for quality and timeliness of work.
Collaborative Approach – You thrive in a collaborative environment and value shared success. You proactively solicit and provide input and excel at communicating complex and technical concepts.
Time Management – You have the ability to manage and prioritize multiple ongoing projects and daily responsibilities.
Academic Training – At a minimum, an undergraduate degree in finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, or related discipline. Completion of CFA or relevant graduate degree is considered an asset.
Industry Experience – You have a passion for quantitative finance, equity investment, data science or related fields.


About Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management is a global institutional asset management firm established in 1982 and based in Vancouver, Canada. Our strong, stable team of investment professionals manages a broad range of investment solutions that includes traditional mandates such as developed and emerging market equities and fixed income, as well as alternative strategies such as portable alpha, market neutral and absolute return.

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd. is part of the Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. (CC&L Financial Group), a multi-boutique investment management company whose affiliates collectively manage over $155 billion in financial assets. Our affiliation with the CC&L Financial Group allows us to best deliver on the mission to provide superior performance and service to our clients.

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

We welcome applications from candidates with different levels of experience, including interns, new graduates, and experienced professionals. The base salary range is $90,000 – $200,000 annually plus a competitive performance bonus. Compensation will be determined based on experience and qualifications.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume, cover letter and academic transcripts.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No telephone calls or agencies will be accepted. Successful applicants must be eligible to work in Canada on their start date.

Apply for this Position

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description

The Position

Uplight is creating a new category of energy. We make software that manages energy resources in homes and businesses—including things like smart thermostats, electric vehicles, solar panels, storage batteries, heat pumps, and even people’s behavior—to generate, shift, or save energy to balance the grid, making it more efficient and reliable. This creates clean energy capacity that can be used by the power grid instead of burning more fossil fuels. Our solutions accelerate the transition to clean energy and save money for energy customers.

We are seeking a Data Engineer focusing on data platform enablement to support our mission and scale our impact

How You Will Make An Impact

As a Data Engineer at Uplight, you’ll play a central role in designing and maintaining the infrastructure that ingests, transforms, and delivers data across our platform. Your work ensures that data systems are reliable, scalable, observable, and cost-efficient—forming the backbone of many customer-facing and data science-driven solutions.

You’ll partner with cross-functional teams including analysts, product managers, and data scientists to ensure the platform meets the evolving needs of our business and our users.

What You Get To Do


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines using Databricks (Spark, Delta Lake) and Python.
Collaborate across teams to develop core platform capabilities—such as orchestration, metadata management, and data quality—delivering scalable, reusable solutions
Improve reliability and fault tolerance of ingest pipelines handling large volumes of utility data.
Build and support MLOps tooling, including data pipelines, model registries, and serving infrastructure
Participate in the full software development lifecycle: design, build, test, deploy, and support
Contribute to a remote-first team that values agility, collaboration, and clarity—favoring whiteboarding, async design docs, and reflective retros over rigid ceremonies.
Continuously learn and grow with support from senior engineers and team leads
Help maintain a team culture rooted in curiosity, empathy, and continuous improvement


What You Bring To Uplight


2–5 years of software engineering experience, ideally in backend or data-focused roles
Experience with Databricks, Spark, or similar big data technologies
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Exposure to cloud platforms such as GCP or AWS
Familiarity with CI/CD tools and infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Docker, Terraform, CircleCI)
Strong communication and collaboration skills; a team player excited to learn and grow


Bonus Points


Familiarity with MLOps concepts and tools (e.g., MLflow, model versioning)
Experience with real-time or streaming data systems (e.g., Kafka, Structured Streaming)
Understanding of data observability, lineage, and quality
Prior work in the energy or utility space
Strong grasp of Big Data challenges including cost vs performance tradeoffs


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women, marginalized genders and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Uplight we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why Join Uplight in Leading the Fight Against Climate Change?

At Uplight, We're Not Just Offering a Job – We're Offering a Chance To Be Part Of The Solution To One Of The World's Biggest Challenges. As a Certified B Corporation, We're Deeply Committed To Both Social And Environmental Responsibility. Here's Why You Should Join Our Team Of Passionate Uplighters


Make a Meaningful Impact: Your work directly impacts our mission of decarbonization and building a more sustainable future.
Grow Your Career: We offer ample advancement opportunities, robust learning and development programs, and a supportive team environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.
Thrive: We offer comprehensive benefits, including flexible time off, generous parental leave, a wellness stipend, and work flexibility to help you thrive both personally and professionally.
Belong to an Inclusive Community: We celebrate diversity and foster an inclusive workplace where everyone feels respected, empowered, and heard. Our Employee Resource Groups offer opportunities to connect with colleagues who share your interests and backgrounds.
Be Part of a Growing Movement: Join a team of dedicated individuals who are passionate about creating a more sustainable future. We offer a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued and your contributions recognized. Together, we can build a brighter tomorrow.


To learn more about our comprehensive benefits package and other perks, visit uplight.com/careers

Salary Range: $90,488 to $113,000 CAD + Bonus

Application Deadline: July 19, 2025

In accordance with Canadian market data the approximate annual base compensation range is listed above. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.

Uplight provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race (including hair texture and hairstyles), color, religion (including head coverings), age, sex, national origin, disability status (including neurodivergence), genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, neurotypicality, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

At Uplight we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why Join Uplight in Leading the Fight Against Climate Change?

At Uplight, We're Not Just Offering a Job – We're Offering a Chance To Be Part Of The Solution To One Of The World's Biggest Challenges. As a Certified B Corporation, We're Deeply Committed To Both Social And Environmental Responsibility. Here's Why You Should Join Our Team Of Passionate Uplighters

  • Make a Meaningful Impact: Your work directly impacts our mission of decarbonization and building a more sustainable future.
  • Grow Your Career: We offer ample advancement opportunities, robust learning and development programs, and a supportive team environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.
  • Thrive: We offer comprehensive benefits, including flexible time off, generous parental leave, a wellness stipend, and work flexibility to help you thrive both personally and professionally.
  • Belong to an Inclusive Community: We celebrate diversity and foster an inclusive workplace where everyone feels respected, empowered, and heard. Our Employee Resource Groups offer opportunities to connect with colleagues who share your interests and backgrounds.
  • Be Part of a Growing Movement: Join a team of dedicated individuals who are passionate about creating a more sustainable future. We offer a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued and your contributions recognized. Together, we can build a brighter tomorrow.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefits package and other perks, visit uplight.com/careers

Salary Range: $90,488 to $113,000 CAD + Bonus

Application Deadline: July 19, 2025

In accordance with Canadian market data the approximate annual base compensation range is listed above. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.

Uplight provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race (including hair texture and hairstyles), color, religion (including head coverings), age, sex, national origin, disability status (including neurodivergence), genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, neurotypicality, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Retail Technology
Description:
Department: Technology

Reports to: Sr. Product Manager, Retail Technology

Location: North Vancouver, B.C.







Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX:




As the Business Systems Analyst you will act as the conduit between technology teams and multiple business teams. You assist with our configuration and integration projects by eliciting and analyzing requirements, liaising between business and technical resources, and documenting business processes or systems and their integration. You must be able to quickly absorb new and different types of information, modify and adapt existing knowledge, and work in a changing and evolving environment to ensure successful project delivery using an agile scrum methodology. You are a critical thinker who enjoys diving into the details and seeking to understand the “how” and “why”, while balancing the need for working software over comprehensive documentation. 

 

Meet Your Future Team:




The retail technology team partners closely with various parts of the business to deliver the Arc’teryx retail experience roadmap. In this role, you will work with talented teams to deliver new systems and enhancements that will strengthen the retail guest experience. We dig in and get to the root of the right problems.




If you were the Business Systems Analyst now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Working with the WFM Product Manager to configure and implement a new WFM Pro product for Arc’teryx retail employees
Working alongside cross-functional teams to elicit, document and review HRM business requirements and policies
Supporting the implementation and configuration of a new HRIS; UKG Pro
Building out and supporting execution of functional test cases, capturing the results in TestRail and collaborating with the project team for defect resolution
Collaborating with various business stakeholders to develop business requirements detailing user stories, use cases, and flow diagrams to support development design and build activities
Ensuring stakeholders are consulted and accepting of the technology product at each step of the implementation journey
Developing subject matter expertise in specific retail domains, ensuring that the technology product maintains exceptional quality when delivered to production
Working alongside internal and external development teams and technology SaaS vendors to implement new technology products, clarifying any questions relating to business requirements or process along the way
Working with Agile teams contributing to successful sprint objectives
Clarifying questions and providing documentation to support completion of development and test phases
Creating understandable visual representations to communicate complex concepts and models for various target audiences




Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
Documenting detailed user stories, process flows, system flows, and acceptance criteria that will be used for business process review, solution & technical architecture, and quality assurance
Identifying and documenting business process, changes, and improvements
Facilitating and managing stakeholder engagement
Maintaining process and system documentation as business and systems evolve
Developing, updating, and embedding your extensive expertise on business areas & technologies in scope within the Business Analysts chapter and the agile squads
Expanding the UKG Pro product to new geographical regions




Are you our next Business Systems Analyst, Retail Technology?
You have a Bachelor’s degree or post-secondary education in business, information systems or a relevant field, completion of a recognized Business Analysis program, and/or equivalent business experience
You have experience working with HRIS and HRM policies
You have experience with UKG Pro configuration, integration, and data migration
You have familiarity with UKG APIs or middleware like Boomi or MuleSoft and business process modeling tools (Visio, Lucidchart), and HR reporting tools
You have experience executing functional testing and working with quality assurance on defect triage & resolution
You have experience in end-to-end HRIS implementation, including requirements gathering, configuration, testing, deployment, and change management
You have an understanding of HR data privacy, security best practices, and regulatory compliance (GDPR, PIPEDA) in HRIS systems
You have 5+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, working on agile projects related to e-commerce and/or retail
You have experience with working in an Agile methodology
You are capable facilitating workshops or stakeholder alignment meetings
You have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of stakeholders to be able to explain, articulate, and document concepts, business processes, systems and business requirements efficiently
You possess a high level of analytical and critical thinking
You have strong troubleshooting skills
You are able to navigate conflict resolution in cross-functional teams
You have and feel comfortable experience using JIRA & Confluence
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment to do what is right
You have experience with working in the (Outdoor) Apparel or Retail industry







Equal Opportunity




Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 




Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  




All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.




Leave it Better

We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way. 

Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world. 




Live it. Get out there - the mountains make us better 

Disruptive evolution. In pursuit of better. Always. 

Commit. We set bold objectives and see them through. 



A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$82,000 - CAD$112,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training. The upper end of the range is typically reserved for candidates with demonstrated expertise that is above job requirements or who bring exceptional directly transferable experience.
Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer (Contract Position)

Number of Positions: 1 Duration: 6 months, possible extension

Location: Vancouver, BC, CA

Must be eligible to work in Canada

Hybrid position for now 4d/w onsite in Vancouver, may change to be fully onsite




Roles and responsibilities:

The Data Engineer to support the development of secure, scalable data integration and analytics solutions within the People Enablement Technology team. This role centers on building and maintaining pipelines using Databricks, with expertise in Python, SQL, Snowflake, Azure Data Factory, and infrastructure tools like Azure DevOps, GitLab, PowerShell, BICEP / Terraform.




Support the design and implementation of complex data integration, modeling, and orchestration workflows using tools such as Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Snowflake

Collaborate with architects, engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to deliver secure, reliable, and high-performing data solutions

Apply DevSecOps principles to ensure secure development, deployment, and monitoring of data pipelines and infrastructure

Implement and maintain data encryption, access controls, and governance using Databricks Unity Catalog to protect sensitive information

Participate in operational support, including troubleshooting, performance tuning, and continuous improvement of data workflows

Create and maintain technical documentation and contribute to knowledge-sharing across the team




The ideal candidate has 5+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong understanding of data encryption, handling sensitive data, and governance using Databricks Unity Catalog. You will partner closely with architects, lead engineers, business analysts, program/project managers, business stakeholders, and platform engineers to deliver secure and reliable data solutions that support people-focused initiatives.




Must have skills/experience/qualifications:

Top 3 Hard Skills Required + Years of Experience: [optional]

Data Engineering with Databricks, SQL & Python - 5+ years

Experience with DevOps tools and building secure, scalable data workflows

Cloud Data Integration & Modelling (Snowflake, Azure Data Factory) - 5+ years




Qualifications, Skills, Experience and Personal Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field, or 5+ years of equivalent experience

5+ years in data engineering with cloud platforms and secure data practices

Strong documentation and communication skills

Self-motivated, adaptable, and collaborative

Comfortable working with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment

Title: Information Technology Business System Analyst
Description:
On behalf of our client we are seeing an experienced Business Systems Analyst to support their Back Office team in a dynamic, project-driven role. You will join a young, enthusiastic team and environment that offers growth and longevity in a stable environment.




This position will help shape the future of critical business systems, from in-house custom web applications to third-party vendor platforms and offers a a unique opportunity to blend your business analysis, project delivery, and data expertise in an environment that values innovation, accountability, and collaboration.




Key responsibilities:

Deliver impactful IT solutions by gathering business requirements, managing deployments, and supporting daily operations.
Support and enhance web-based applications, ensuring high availability and business alignment.
Analyze business processes, translate needs into technical requirements, and help design solutions that make a difference.
Investigate and resolve data or calculation discrepancies in financial reports by querying and analyzing source data using SQL.
Develop and execute test plans, document procedures, and assist in troubleshooting issues.
Drive data insights using tools like SQL, Tableau, and Power BI—supporting everything from operational reports to ad hoc business requests.
Collaborate with technical teams, stakeholders, and vendors to manage small-to-medium projects and improve systems functionality.




Required experience:

5+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst, ideally in software/web development environments.
Strong understanding of web application lifecycles, from requirements to deployment and support.
Proven skills in SQL, with hands-on experience querying and validating data.
Familiarity with database IDEs such as DataGrip or Toad
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Sigma, Power BI, or SSRS.
Experience managing and contributing to projects using Agile methodologies.
Clear, confident communication skills and an ability to build strong relationships with technical and non-technical users alike.
A proactive, inquisitive mindset, with a track record of taking ownership and delivering results.
Detail oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills
Exposure to Python, PowerShell, or other scripting languages.
Familiarity with vendor-based systems and cloud-hosted solutions
Past co-op or office experience in a technical or analytical role.




If you are a curious, self motivated problem-solver with a passion for technology and data, don't hesitate to apply and help make a difference within an impactful BC Based company.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

Cymax Group Technologies is a leading eCommerce technology and logistics services platform for big & bulky vendors and retailers. We maximize the best of technology, automation, and AI to simplify the complexities of eCommerce through our two products - Channel Gate and Freight Club. We partner with vendors and retailers to tackle some of the industry’s biggest challenges, offering prescriptive recommendations to optimize their ROI in a competitive market. Our remote-flexible team works to support our partners from the US and Canada.

About The Role

The Data Engineerplays a pivotal role in designing, building, and maintaining scalable, robust, and secure data pipelines and architectures that enable our analytics and business intelligence teams to derive actionable insights. This role will collaborate cross-functionally with data analysts, data scientists, software engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure our data infrastructure supports current and future needs.

This is a hybrid role, 1-2 days in the office, based in the Vancouver, BC area.

🌟 What You’ll Be Doing


ETL/ELT Development: Design, develop, and deploy scalable ETL/ELT processes for diverse data sources.
Workflow Optimization: Optimize data workflows for performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency in hybrid cloud (Azure/Databricks) and on-prem environments (SQL Server).
Data Quality & Governance: Implement data quality, validation, and governance frameworks to ensure high data integrity.
Storage Solutions Maintenance: Maintain and enhance data warehouse, data lake, and other storage solutions for performance and resilience.
Automation & Monitoring: Automate routine data operations and develop monitoring systems to proactively detect and resolve issues.
Tool & Technology Integration: Evaluate and integrate new tools and technologies to support evolving data needs and industry best practices.
Collaboration with Analytics Teams: Collaborate with analytics and data science teams to deliver clean, well-modeled datasets for self-service analytics and advanced modeling.
Documentation: Develop and maintain clear documentation of data pipelines, processes, and architectural decisions.


🧠 What You Bring


Experience: 3+ years of experience in a data engineering or backend developer role.
SQL Proficiency: Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with modern data warehousing solutions.
Hybrid Data Environment: Comfortable working in a hybrid data environment, supporting both on-prem (SQL Server) and cloud-based data warehouses (Databricks).
Programming Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Scala, or Java for data pipeline development.
Orchestration & Version Control: Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect, Dagster) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
Data Modeling & Distributed Computing: Solid understanding of data modeling, data lakes, and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Spark).


💡 Bonus Points If You Have:


Experience with Business Intelligence Tools: Exposure to business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and enabling semantic layers is an asset.


Compensation

The Salary Range for this role is between $75,000 and $90,000, depending on experience. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. We offer a comprehensive range of benefits which includes:


Health and wellness support for our team members and their families including an employee assistance program
100% paid premiums for health and dental benefits in Canada
Paid time off
Easy access to online and phone-based counselling services
And a remote-flexible work environment.


Join Our AI Journey at Cymax Group!

At Cymax Group, we thrive on innovation and entrepreneurship. As an AI-first organization, we are on an exciting journey to continuously grow and evolve our focus on AI, empowering our people at all levels. Our fast-paced environment encourages agility and nimbleness, enabling our team to adapt swiftly to changing market dynamics. We're passionate about continuous learning and growth, offering opportunities for professional development. Our data-driven decision-making ensures we make informed choices that lead to success. If you're excited about making an impact and being part of a dynamic, AI-empowered team, you'll feel right at home here.

Join us and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. Apply now to make a significant impact at Cymax Group Technologies and Freight Club!

Accessibility

We can provide accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Database Developer
Description:
We are looking for a Database Developer for one of our Insurance clients in Vancouver.




Client : Insurance

Location: fully onsite at Vancouver

Database Development - 7+ yrs of experience is preferred

Strong understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and database technologies.
Experience with any relational database is good (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL)

Experience in data modeling techniques and database design principles
Experience in identifying and resolving database performance issues
Knowledge of AWS cloud platform

  • Experience with any relational database is good (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL)
  • Advanced skills in writing, debugging and optimizing SQL queries
  • Experience in data modeling techniques and database design principles
  • Experience in identifying and resolving database performance issues
  • Knowledge of AWS cloud platform


Java Development:

  • Extensive experience in Java Development
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) principles
  • Proficiency in Java frameworks like Spring and Hibernate Ø Knowledge in technologies - React, REST

Title: Data Visualization Lab Technician
Description:
Staff - Non Union

Job Category

Non Union Technicians and Research Assistants

Job Profile

Non Union Hourly - Research Assistant /Technician 3

Job Title

Data Visualization Lab Technician

Department

Research Support | Wittman Research Group | Applied Biology Program | Faculty of Land and Food Systems

Compensation Range

$28.10 - $33.14 CAD Hourly

Posting End Date

July 22, 2025

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the Posting End Date.

Job End Date

Jan 31, 2026

This position is expected to be filled by promotion/reassignment and is included here to inform you of its vacancy at the University.

At UBC, we believe that attracting and sustaining a diverse workforce is key to the successful pursuit of excellence in research, innovation, and learning for all faculty, staff and students. Our commitment to employment equity helps achieve inclusion and fairness, brings rich diversity to UBC as a workplace, and creates the necessary conditions for a rewarding career.

Job Summary

This position will provide technical support to Wittman Lab Group for Data Visualization for ongoing research as well as provide assistance in lab management.

Organizational Status

Reports to the Principal Investigator (Dr. Hannah Wittman). This position will work in Dr. Wittman’s group consisting of technicians, graduate and undergraduate students at UBC's Vancouver campus.

Work Performed


Works with researchers at the Centre for Sustainable Food Systems (CSFS), the Agroecological Transitions Research Coordinator and CSFS researchers to source CSFS research datasets, including LiteFarm data, and scope out how to visualize them in interactive web and data app dashboards;
Supports the development, implementation, and evaluation of farm data visualizations for the LiteFarm research team;
Supports the improvement of CSFS research data collection, visualization and sharing tools and processes to make research data more accessible.


Consequence of Error/Judgement

Incorrect decisions would likely be costly in terms of wasted time and flawed data. Inappropriate judgment will cause missing data or biased results. Missed deadlines will delay timelines in the Professor’s research project.

Supervision Received

Reports to the Principal Investigator (Dr. Hannah Wittman).

Supervision Given

None.

Minimum Qualifications

Completion of a relevant technical program or a university degree in a relevant discipline and a minimum three years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Willingness to respect diverse perspectives, including perspectives in conflict with one’s own
Demonstrates a commitment to enhancing one’s own awareness, knowledge, and skills related to equity, diversity, and inclusion


Preferred Qualifications


Preference for an Undergraduate degree in Data Science or Masters of Science is preferred.
Comfortable working with CSV and MS Excel complex datasets
Experience generating interactive data visualizations (ideally in Tableau) for research and communication purposes
Comfortable using programs such as MS Word, Excel or additional survey tools for research management (Qualtrics, Google forms, etc.)
Familiarity with management of spatial data (QGIS, etc.) is an asset
Efficient organizational and communication (written and verbal) skills
Self-motivated, organized, efficient, able to multi-task and work well independently and collaboratively in a dynamic work environment and under time constraints and deadlines;
Interested and informed about diversified agriculture, food sustainability and environmental stewardship.
Familiarity with agro-ecology, biodiversity, food production data
Must use time efficiently and able to multi-task.
Must have accuracy and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and within a team environment.

Title: Analytics Engineer – Data Modeling & Migration
Description:
Job Title: Analytics Engineer – Data Modeling & Migration

Location: Remote (Canada)

Department: Data & Analytics

Reports To: Manager, Data Integration & Architecture

Mogo is seeking an Analytics Engineer who thrives at the intersection of business understanding and technical execution. In this dual-focus role, you will work closely with stakeholders across the finance business to define and build semantic models in Snowflake, while also contributing to upcoming data migration initiatives that involve rebuilding and modernizing our core Python-based ETL pipelines.

This position is a 50/50 blend of business-facing semantic modeling and production-grade data engineering, offering a unique opportunity to drive both insight accessibility and data infrastructure modernization. You will become the subject matter expert (SME) for Mogo’s core consumer finance products and help shape the next generation of AI-powered analytics at Mogo.

Base salary for this role: $80,000 - $100,000 CAD

What You’ll Do & Key Responsibilities:2. Data Engineering & Migration (50%)3. Culture & High PerformanceWhat you will bring:


Business-Facing Semantic Modeling (50%)
Design and maintain semantic data models in Snowflake to support our products, powering self-service analytics via Cortex Analyst
Partner with Finance, Product, and Risk teams to define KPIs, translate business logic into reusable data models, and ensure consistent reporting
Collaborate on the development of an AI-powered chatbot using Streamlit (Python) that answers natural language questions based on semantic models
Act as the SME for Mogo’s core consumer finance products, ensuring models are well-aligned with business workflows and financial reporting needs
Support and lead aspects of data migration initiatives by analyzing, redesigning, and implementing production-grade Python ETL pipelines
Ensure new data pipelines are reliable, scalable, and observable, with appropriate documentation and governance
Work closely with other teams to integrate ETL pipelines into the broader production environment
Embody and model Mogo’s high-performance attributes: ownership, collaboration, innovation, speed, and impact
Share knowledge and best practices across teams to foster data-driven decision-making
4–7 years experience in a data engineering, analytics engineering, or hybrid data role
Strong proficiency in Python for building, testing, and maintaining ETL workflows
Experience building or maintaining semantic data models in Snowflake or similar platforms
Strong understanding of SQL, data modeling, and dimensional modeling practices
Ability to work closely with stakeholders to capture requirements and translate them into robust data structures
Experience working with AI powered analytics tools or interfaces (e.g., Cortex Analyst, conversational analytics)
Familiarity with best practices in production-grade ETL deployment: testing, monitoring, observability


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with data orchestration tools (e.g., Talend, Airflow)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker)
Familiarity with financial services, particularly lending, credit risk, or loan servicing
Experience contributing to data platform modernization or migration initiatives


What Success Looks Like


Lending business teams rely on your semantic models for fast, self-serve answers to critical questions
You have redesigned and deployed reliable Python ETLs that support Mogo’s modern data infrastructure
You’re known across teams as the go-to expert for our core data and a trusted technical partner in data transformation efforts


Benefits of working with us:


ALWAYS FULLY REMOTE WORK - Enjoy the flexibility of remote work, supported by necessary resources
Comprehensive Health and Wellness - Access medical, dental, and vision coverage plus a Health Spending Account
Stock Options - Have a stake in the company's success through stock options
Flex Vacation - Benefit from paid time off, including vacation days, holidays, and personal days
Wellbeing Programs - Access counselling services, mental health support, and additional wellness resources


About Us:

We help make it easy for Canadians to achieve financial freedom while making a positive impact.

We live in the most innovative and technologically advanced era, yet so much struggle exists. Most of us are far from where we want to be financially.

We all want a better future. A better world where reaching financial freedom is a question of when, not if. One that's equitable so that all can prosper. One that's safe from the impact of climate change.

Our money has the power to change the world. It’s up to us to do things differently.

Apply today! Do you know anyone who would be a great fit for this role or other roles on our career page? Please share this job posting with them! Mogo is an inclusive place to spend your work life. We hire team members for their talent and diverse backgrounds. Bring your unique perspective to Mogo and help our customers achieve their best financial lives.
